creator: imtiaz.sayed@ge.com
text:
The issue we are having is very much identical to what has been expressed in Bug 21095 (https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=21095) with the only exception being is that we are using version 2.0.59.
Appreciate if someone can help us out here. This is breaking a very critical functionality for us.

Thanks
Imtiaz
Please post a full bug report, since the PR you cite is already alegedly fixed in your level of Apache (input SSI, response, config, logs)
creator: covener@gmail.com
imtiaz.sayed@ge.com
text:
Our tech stack consists of apache 2.0.59 --> mod_jk 1.2.18 --> tomcat 5.5.16 --> oracle 11g.
We form and post a response in a jsp that consists of a list of many server side includes that is processed by apache.
However apache throws an inexplicable ssi error (example below) intermittently on any one of the includes.
[Wed Dec 23 12:00:59 2009] unable to include "Hash" >\r\n        \t <!--#include virtual="/ge/newsclips/104/286/4115493.html" in parsed file

If we add some extra characters to the jsp like a space or carriage return then the response works fine and we don't see any broken includes.
The error however returns when a new include is added to the list.

-Imtiaz

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
maybe https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=44447

which has simple patch:

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=629456

OP, can you rebuild your mod_include?

Appreciate your quick response Eric. We are running on version 2.0.59 whereas the patch below seems to be for the 2.2.x version series.
I can rebuild mod_include if you can please advise on what changes to incorporate.

Thanks
Imtiaz
creator: imtiaz.sayed@ge.com
covener@gmail.com
text: 2.0 is EOL, reopen if you move up to a contemporary level and it doesn't work.
